question: List proteins with RING domain.
ideal_answer:
RING1
TRIM proteins
TRAF6 
UHRF1
MARCH7
SINA
BRCA1

snippets.text: The RING domain of RING1 was required for its E3 Ub ligase activity.
The TRIM proteins are classically characterized by the presence of an amino-terminal RING domain and a B-box domain followed by a coiled coil domain
the detailed mechanism by which the TRAF6 RING dimer promotes ubiquitin transfer was unknown.
RING ubiquitin E3 ligases enclose a RING domain for ubiquitin ligase activity
MARCH7, a RING domain-containing ubiquitin E3 ligase,
Seven in absentia (SINA) protein is one subgroup of ubiquitin ligases possessing an N-terminal cysteine-rich really interesting new gene (RING) domain,
The BRCA1 RING domain is a ubiquitin ligase

exact_answer: RING1, TRIM proteins, TRAF6, UHRF1, MARCH7, SINA, BRCA1
